item.title: How Can i Assign this to a skillcape?[317]
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Why not use a switch statement, so he can assign all capes in the same command.

[code]
if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“cape”))
{
switch(playerEquipment[playerCape])
{
case 4327:
specGFX(481);
setAnimation(1115);
break;
default:
sM(“This cape is not programmed.”);//may need to be changed to sendMessage
break;
}
}

Should work, with some minor variations to the code.[/code]

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @medievalsoli medievalsoli
item.description:
@medievalsoli wrote:

compiler
client.java:10349: illegal start of expression
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 4327) && if(command.startsWith(“cape”) {
^
client.java:10349: illegal start of expression
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 4327) && if(command.startsWith(“cape”) {
^
client.java:10349: ‘)’ expected
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 4327) && if(command.startsWith(“cape”) {
^
client.java:10349: not a statement
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 4327) && if(command.startsWith(“cape”) {
^
4 errors
Finished!

@vengscape wrote:

bassically man u need this code in full somewhere in client.java server sided:

if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 4319) && if(command.startsWith(“emote”) {
specGFX(481);
setAnimation(1115);
}

Good Luck
